newsitem.title: USA: MK Gold to suspend American Girl mining.
newsitem.headline: MK Gold to suspend American Girl mining.

text.p: MK Gold Co. said it would suspend mining and milling operations at the American Girl joint venture gold mine in California effective Nov. 4.

The mine, located in Imperial County, Calif., is 53 percent owned by MK Gold and 47 percent owned by Hecla Mining Co. MK Gold said it expected to record a charge against earnings in the second quarter of fiscal 1997 to account for its share of the closure and reclamation costs.
MK Gold said mining and milling activities would continue until the remaining accessible underground and open pit ores were extracted.
The joint venture is evaluating additional mineral potential at the property and various reclamation and closure alternatives, MK said.
Employees at the facility will begin receiving notices on Sept. 3. About 115 of them will be laid off on or shortly after Nov. 4.
